action.action-desc: Mr. Vindman (for himself and Mr. Mills) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to expand the ability of an individual entitled to Post-9/11 education benefits to transfer such benefits to dependents.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Family GI Bill Promise Act.

section.header: Expansion of ability of an individual entitled to Post-9/11 education benefits to transfer such benefits to dependents
section.text: Section 3319 of title 38, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by inserting (including a member who has separated from the uniformed services) after any member of the uniformed services;
in paragraph (1), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (3); and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following new paragraph (2):

paragraph.text: 10 years of service in the uniformed services, at least six of which were in the Armed Forces; or

subparagraph.text: by striking and except as provided in subsection (k) or (l),; and
by striking only while serving as a member of the Armed Forces when the transfer is executed and inserting at any time; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (k), by striking , notwithstanding whether the individual is serving as a member of the Armed Forces when such transfer is executed.
